fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Sport, Borders and Security, Communication
eu_initiatives: The Premier League is interested in the development of the EU Sport Policy as well as in various EU initiatives related to audio-visual policy and media rights, competition and internal market rules, free movement of workers, and social dialogue. The Premier League is also committed to provide the EU institutions with its experience and expertise in using football as a tool for improving education, health and social integration.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
belgium_office_address: CBI House Rue de la Science, 14
membership:
The Premier League is a member of  
- the European Professional Football League Association (EPFL) 
- the Sports Rights Owners' Coalition (SROC) 
- Creativity Works!
goals__remit: The Premier League organises and commercialises the top division of English football, with the 20 Clubs at any one time in the League being the Shareholders. The Premier League acts as its clubs trade association as well as its competition organiser and regulator.
